FuncDef:
The trap-threshold ces command configures thresholds for generating and clearing a CES service performance threshold-crossing alarm.
The undo trap-threshold ces command restores the default thresholds for generating and clearing a CES service performance threshold-crossing alarm.
By default, all alarm functions are enabled.
CLIs: trap-threshold { ces-jtrovr-exc | ces-jtrudr-exc | ces-lospkt-exc | ces-malpkt-exc | ces-misorderpkt-exc | ces-straypkt-exc } trigger-threshold <trigger-threshold> resume-threshold <resume-threshold>
undo trap-threshold { ces-jtrovr-exc | ces-jtrudr-exc | ces-lospkt-exc | ces-malpkt-exc | ces-misorderpkt-exc | ces-straypkt-exc }

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for overflows in the jitter buffer.
-

Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for underflows in the jitter buffer.
-

Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for packet drops every second.
-

Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for malformed packets every second.
-

Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for disordered packets every second.
-

Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for stray packets every second.
-

Sets an alarm generation threshold.
The value is an integer, in packets (times)/second. The alarm generation threshold for ces-lospkt-exc, ces-misorderpkt-exc, ces-straypkt-exc, and ces-malpkt-exc ranges from 1 to 1000, and the default value is 5. The alarm threshold for ces-jtrudr-exc and ces-jtrovr-exc ranges from 1 to 1000, and the default value is 1.

Sets an alarm clearance threshold. resume-threshold-value must be smaller than trigger-threshold-value.
The value is an integer, in packets (times)/second. The alarm clearance threshold for ces-lospkt-exc, ces-misorderpkt-exc, ces-straypkt-exc, ces-malpkt-exc, ces-jtrudr-exc, and ces-jtrovr-exc ranges from 1 to 1000, and the default value is 0.

Sets the alarm generation and clearance thresholds for Continuous loss of packets in a certain period.
-

Threshold for ces-lops alarm generation.
The value is an integer that ranges from 2 to 65535, and the default value is 128.

Threshold for ces-lops alarm clearance.
The value is an integer that ranges from 32 to 65535, and the default value is 872.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure thresholds for generating and clearing a CES service performance threshold-crossing alarm, run the trap-threshold ces command. If the alarm generation threshold is reached, the system generates an alarm. If the alarm clearance threshold is reached, the system clears the alarm.
Precautions
The alarm clearance threshold must be smaller than the alarm generation threshold for ces-lospkt-exc, ces-misorderpkt-exc, ces-straypkt-exc, ces-malpkt-exc, ces-jtrudr-exc and ces-jtrovr-exc.
The trap-threshold ces command can be configured only on serial interfaces and trunk serial interfaces that are encapsulated with TDM.
